name: Tommy Trojan
description: Iconic USC landmark and symbol of the university. The bronze statue of a Trojan warrior stands guard in the heart of campus.

name: Doheny Memorial Library (DML)
description: Historic library featuring beautiful architecture and extensive research collections. Houses Special Collections and multiple specialized libraries.

name: Leavey Library (LVL)
description: Modern 24-hour study facility with collaborative workspaces, computer labs, and caf√©.

name: Accounting Library
description: Specialized library for accounting and business resources.

name: Architecture and Fine Arts Library
description: Specialized library supporting architecture, landscape architecture, and fine arts programs.

name: Cinematic Arts Library
description: Library dedicated to film, television, and interactive media resources.

name: East Asian Library
description: Comprehensive collection of East Asian materials in Doheny Memorial Library.

name: Gaughan & Tiberti Library
description: Library serving the needs of students and faculty in business and related fields.

name: Gerontology Library Services
description: Specialized library supporting aging and gerontology research and education.

name: Hoose Library of Philosophy
description: Dedicated philosophy library with extensive philosophical texts and resources.

name: Law Library
description: Comprehensive legal research library serving USC Gould School of Law.

name: LIPA Library
description: Library supporting the Laband Art Gallery and art history programs.

name: Music Library
description: Extensive collection of musical scores, recordings, and music research materials.

name: Science & Engineering Library
description: Specialized library supporting science, technology, engineering, and mathematics programs.

name: Special Collections, Doheny Memorial Library
description: Rare books, manuscripts, and unique archival materials.

name: Wilson Dental Library
description: Library serving the Herman Ostrow School of Dentistry with dental and health sciences resources.

name: Hancock Memorial Museum
description: Historic museum showcasing USC history and artifacts.

name: USC Village
description: State-of-the-art residential and retail complex featuring dining, housing, and shopping.

name: Lyon Center
description: Premier fitness and recreation center with gym, pool, and various sports facilities.

name: Bovard Auditorium
description: Historic auditorium hosting lectures, performances, and special events.

name: USC School of Cinematic Arts
description: World-renowned film school with cutting-edge facilities and production studios.

name: Galen Center
description: Multi-purpose arena and home to USC basketball and volleyball teams.

name: Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum
description: Historic stadium, home of USC football and host of two Olympic Games.

name: Taper Hall
description: Humanities and social sciences building with modern classrooms.

name: Mudd Hall of Philosophy
description: Home to the USC School of Philosophy.

name: Tutor Campus Center
description: Student center with dining options, bookstore, and meeting spaces.

name: Parkside Dining Hall
description: All-you-can-eat dining facility with diverse food stations.

name: Viterbi School of Engineering
description: State-of-the-art engineering facilities and research labs.

name: Marshall School of Business
description: Top-ranked business school with modern facilities and experiential learning centers.
